location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 6323/46 'Weekly appreciation (Political) Report 28 August 1946 from HM Consulate-General Antananarivo'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commencesat the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5;these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the topright corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a copy of a weekly Appreciation Political Report from P I Lake (Acting Consul-General, Antananarivo) on behalf of the British Consulate-General, Antananarivo addressed to the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs. A copy has also been forwarded to the War Office. The report includes information on recent local disagreements in the area of Tamative, an official visit to Tamative with Jules Marcel de Coppet (High Commissioner of Madagascar), local press interpretations of a planned visit by Marius Moutet, French Minister for Colonies, and the suggested scapegoating of the areaâ€™s Indian community by a local Communist newspaper.
